ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: By taking this course, I really honed my ability to think critically about scholarly writings and the role of religion in society.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The biggest strength of this course was Professor Grewal. In a very emotionally challenging semester given the state of the world, Professor Grewal created a space where we were able to talk freely about our thoughts and feelings in a comfortable and safe manner. She helped us work through very challenging emotions in a way that allowed us to grow in our understanding of Islam, media, war, society, and more. I can't emphasize enough how grateful I was to have this class and Professor Grewal to turn to throughout the semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Without a doubt, I would recommend this course to any student at Yale. Professor Grewal is so knowledgable about the topic and she has so much lived experience studying and speaking about the content.
Yes! If you are interested in Muslims in America this is an amazing class
Absolutely. The course covers a ton of ground, and does so in a way that feels really meaningful.

I loved this seminar! Professor Grewal is truly wonderful and creates a welcoming learning environment for all her students. While the readings for the class may be a higher workload than other classes you've taken, they were all full of interesting/engaging content that made the long reads feel worthwhile. The professor makes this course, she teaches/lectures in a very engaging way and offers room for thoughtful discussion with students. Definitely take this class if you can manage the workload and have an interest in the topic!
